header.title: JPOX EMF Resources
header.notice: Describes the use of emf resource implemenations for jpox
header.abstract: From the 0.7.0 release the EMF-JPOX integration offers one type of resource: JPOXResourceDAO. It extends the org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceImpl.

section.title: Resource URI
section.p: The integration layer automatically registers the JPOX resource for the protocol: jpox and jpoxdao. The jpoxdao protocol is deprecated and present because of backwards compatibility.
From the 0.7.0 the EMF-JPOX integration offers one type of resource: JPOXResourceDAO. The previous JPOXResource is no longer used. The jpox protocol will from now return a JPOXResourceDAO instance.

The JPOX resource needs to know how to reach a data store. This is done by passing the name of a JpoxDataStore to the resource with the JPOXResourceDAO.DS_NAME_PARAM parameter. The name of the JpoxDataStore is the name used when creating/registering a JpoxDataStore using the JpoxHelper.INSTANCE object.
An example of a URI which returns a JPOX resource: jpox://dsname=MyPMF.

section.title: JPOX (DAO) Resource
section.p: The JPOX DAO Resource (org.elver.store.jpox.resource.JPOXResourceDAO) starts and completes a transaction in the load action and reopens and commits a transaction for the save action. This behavior has the following consequences:

ul.li: A transaction is only open during the time of the load or save action and not in between.
After saving the resource the saved objects can still be used by the application, so no refresh is required.
ELists are lazily loaded, primitive type fields and single EReferences are loaded when the resource is loaded.

section.title: Validation
section.p: The JPOX Resource automatically validates its content (the EObjects) when the resource is saved. This validation makes use of the EMF validation framework through calls to the Diagnostician.INSTANCE.validate method. Validation fails when a ERROR level Diagnostic is encountered. In this case the resource save method will throw an org.elver.store.StoreValidationException. This exception has a method to retrieve all Diagnostics.

section.title: Standard load behavior: Top level types
section.p: When a EMF/JPOX resource is loaded (without using the query customizations) then only the so called top-level types are directly present in the resource contents. Top-level types are types which are not used as the the child in a containment relation. The assumption is that all contained types can be reached from a top-level type.

section.title: Customizing load behavior
section.p: It is possible to customize what the resource actually loads from the database.

section.title: Extend the resource implementation with a Java subclass
section.p: It is possible to customize the load behavior by overriding the loadFromStore method in JPOXResourceDAO. This method gets a PersistenceManager and should return a list of objects read from the JDO/JPOX datastore.

Two things are important here: 1) for JDO the query should fully qualified classnames to the concrete implementation classes, 2) you can pass multiple queries by using parameter names which start with query, for example query1, query2 etc.

section.title: Closing a resource
section.p: The EMF/JPOX resource can be closed by calling the unload method. This method will close the used Persistence Manager.
